flawed_nl_solution:
His utilities cost 1/2 the amount of his $250 car payment so his utilities cost 250/2 = $<<250/2=215>>215
All total, his bills cost him 775+250+215+50 = $<<775+250+215+50=1290>>1290
He makes $2500 a month and his bills cost $1290 a month so that leaves him with 2500-1290 = $<<2500-1290=1210>>1210
He wants to put half of $1210 into a retirement account so he will invest 1210/2= $<<1210/2=605>>605 into his retirement account
He had 1210 and puts $605 into his retirement account so that leaves him with 1210-605 = $<<1210-605=605>>605 remaining
#### 605

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 125, not 215. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
